intro: Saussurea salwinensis, commonly known as the Salwin saussurea, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, often in rocky or alpine habitats. It features a tall, slender stem with narrow, grass-like leaves and produces yellow to brown flowers. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
